content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: DSCAT
      operator: equal_to
      value: DISPOSITION EVENT
      value_is_literal: true
    - name: DSSCAT
      operator: exists
    - name: EPOCH
      operator: is_not_unique_set
      value: DSSCAT
Core:
  Id: CORE-000213
  Version: '1'
  Status: Published
Description: Trigger error when there is more than one record per subject per DSSCAT
  per EPOCH
Outcome:
  Message: More than one record per subject per DSSCAT per EPOCH
  Output Variables:
    - DSSCAT
    - EPOCH
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0536
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: If disposition events for both study participation
                  and study treatment(s) are to be represented, then DSSCAT provides
                  this distinction.
                Document: IG v3.4
                Item: Assumption 2.b
                Section: 6.2.3
              - Cited Guidance: "ICH E3: Section 10.1 indicates that 'the specific\
                  \ reason for discontinuation' should be presented, and that summaries\
                  \ should be 'grouped by treatment and by major reason.' The CDISC\
                  \ SDS Team interprets this guidance as requiring one standardized\
                  \ disposition term (DSDECOD) per disposition event. If multiple\
                  \ reasons are reported, the sponsor should identify a primary reason\
                  \ and use that to populate DSTERM and DSDECOD. Additional reasons\
                  \ should be submitted in SUPPDS."
                Document: IG v3.4
                Item: Assumption 5
                Section: 6.2.3
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - EVENTS
  Domains:
    Include:
      - DS

json.Description: Trigger error when there is more than one record per subject per DSSCAT per EPOCH

Outcome.Message: More than one record per subject per DSSCAT per EPOCH

Citations.Cited_Guidance: If disposition events for both study participation and study treatment(s) are to be represented, then DSSCAT provides this distinction.

ICH E3: Section 10.1 indicates that 'the specific reason for discontinuation' should be presented, and that summaries should be 'grouped by treatment and by major reason.' The CDISC SDS Team interprets this guidance as requiring one standardized disposition term (DSDECOD) per disposition event. If multiple reasons are reported, the sponsor should identify a primary reason and use that to populate DSTERM and DSDECOD. Additional reasons should be submitted in SUPPDS.
